CHAPTER 1-2 
ELECTIONS 
 
 
 
 
 
1-2-1  
 
NUMBER OF WARDS 
 
 
 
The City of Brandon is hereby divided into three (3) wards of substantially equal 
population. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Legislative History:     
 
 
Authority: 
 
 
 
Ordinance No. 33, §11, 3/8/76      
Try SDCL §§ 9-13-16, 12-14-1 
 
 
1-2-2  
 
WARD BOUNDARIES 
The wards shall be described by setting for the certain street, avenue or boulevard 
designations or other landmarks that divide and border the wards.  Any reference to 
street, avenue or boulevard below shall mean an imaginary line running down the 
approximate middle of each street, avenue or boulevard. The wards of the City of 
Brandon are as set forth below and the map thereof on file in the office of the Finance 
Officer. Any discrepancies shall be resolved by reference to the map rather than the 
physical descriptions set forth herein.  
 
 
 
 
A.. 
WARD I 
Ward I shall consists of all the land within the city limits lying west of North 
and South Sioux Blvd and south of East Aspen Blvd between South Sioux Blvd 
and the Ellis and Eastern Railroad Tracks,  
 
 
 
 
B. 
Ward II 
Ward II shall consist of all the land within the city limits lying east of North 
Sioux Blvd (481st Ave) and South Sioux Blvd, North of East Aspen Blvd and 
west of Splitrock Blvd (Hwy 11)  
 
 
 
 
C. 
Ward III 
Ward III shall consist of all the land within the city limits lying east of North 
and South Splitrock Boulevard (Hwy 11), south of East Aspen Blvd to the west 
of the Ellis and Eastern Railroad Tracks.

Authority:

1-2-3  
 
WARD BOUNDARY CHANGES 
 
 
 
The City Council, by ordinance, shall make such changes in ward boundaries to maintain 
as nearly as practicable the same number of inhabitants in each ward. 
 
 
 
 
Legislative History:     
 
 
Authority: 
 
 
 
Ordinance No. 33, §13, 3/8/76;     
Try SDCL §§ 9-13-16, 12-14-1 
 
 
 
Ordinance No 113, §1, 12/21/81. 
 
 
1-2-4  
 
POLL HOURS 
 
 
 
Polls will open at 7:00 a.m. and close at 7:00 p.m. for annual municipal elections. 
 

 
 
 
Legislative History:     
 
 
Authority: 
 
 
 
Ordinance No. 284, 2/2/00     
 
 
SDCL §§ 9-13-1. 
 
 
 
1-2-5  
 
ANNUAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION 
 
 
 
The Municipal Election for the City of Brandon will be held annually on the second 
Tuesday of April. 
 
 
 
 
Legislative History:     
 
 
Authority: 
 
 
 
Ordinance No. 439 3/3/09     
 
 
SDCL §§ 9-13-1.
